page.title: 17UPPER ANNANDALE EDUCATION
page.content: Moffat Academy is an example of a dying species-an all-through Burgh school.There has been a school on the site(N.end of the town)since 1834,the present since 1933.Several modern extensions have allowed the school to adapt to changing needs.The Academy is now the only school in the town,the culmination of a process started by the 1872 Education Act.Some 20 schools have been identified in and around the town in the last 100 years.Several died out by the turn of the century as the Academy gained the confidence of more parents.During the first half of the century 7 rural schools closed,the children now travelling daily to the Academy.Recently the last private shool,an amalgam of 4 such,closed due to a lack of support.The present Academy has 420 pupils(aged from 5 to 16) and 33 teaching staff.
